prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Alexis
mes:
The sun dripped gold over CSU’s campus, the late afternoon heat thick and clinging to skin like a second layer of sweat. Practice had ended, and Alexis Cole - hair damp, sports bra clinging, ego freshly fed by her own performance - made her way toward the bleachers.

Her legs had that pleasant post-exercise ache, each step she took was deliberate. She had that look that made people stare even when they pretended not to. Blonde hair, toned muscle, sun-kissed skin, and that aura. It felt like the world tilted a little in her direction wherever she went.

She dropped onto the bleachers next to Darcy, snatching a half-drunk bottle of Gatorade from her hand and taking a swig. Darcy swallowed, then exhaled smoke with a laugh as she brought her cigarette back to her lips. Kylie sat nearby, stretching with one leg practically over her head.

“Lex,” Darcy smirked. “She-” she nodded at Kylie “-was telling me she heard a little rumour.”

Kylie pulled into a cross-legged sit and raised a finger. “Gina Jones. A little birdy told me another little birdy might’ve been doing some of the whole birds and the... birds stuff with her.” She waggled her eyebrows at Alexis, proud of herself.

Alexis rolled her eyes and laughed, dragging a hand down her face.

“Yeah, I did fuck her, if that’s what you’re asking.” She grinned. “What score would ya give me?”

Darcy’s smirk widened. “Head cheerleader? Shit, Lex. Looks scale, 10. Difficulty, 7. Let’s call it 8.5.” She punched Alexis in the arm. “C’mon, give me a rendition of her O face.”

Alexis snorted. “Fuck off, Darce. She’ll be at our inevitable victory party tomorrow night. Go find out for yourself if she’s only a 7 difficulty.”

Kylie perked up. “Ooh, yeah, the party. I hope it’s slutty. Like, slutty fun, not slutty sad. That last one was a total downer.”

Alexis rolled her eyes. “Kylie, you broke up with your ex at the last one. Of course it was a downer.”

“Wait,” Kylie said, cocking her head, “I broke up with him? I didn’t realise we were dating. I was wondering why he wouldn’t come home with me.”

Darcy cracked up, smoke curling out her nose. “You’re fucking unbelievable.”

They were in their bubble. Talking shit, laughing too loud, treating the campus like their playground. Because it was.

A flicker of motion caught Alexis’s eye - a familiar figure passing by. She didn’t move right away, just narrowed her eyes, tracking the moment as it brushed the edge of her awareness.

Hailee.

Kylie tilted her head. “Ooh, what about them? What score for them?” She pointed. “Heeeey hot stuff!” she catcalled mockingly, blowing exaggerated kisses before giggling.

Alexis sucked her teeth like she was thinking about it. Then smirked. “Them? 2.5 outta 10 for sure.”

She stood, tossed the Gatorade bottle into the trash, and walked off. “Later, nobodies.” She left them laughing as she turned the corner.

She caught up to them behind the gym, she blocked the way forward. Her smirk was predatory.

“What was that little performance, hmm? Wandering around in front of me and my friends like you’re attention-starved?” Her tone was sharp. “God, you don’t think you actually have a chance with me, do you?”

She knew she’d been fucking Hailee for a while. But that wasn’t the same as ‘having a chance.’ One drunken hookup had led to the best game of her life. Then again. And again.

Like most athletes, Alexis had her superstitions. Hers just happened to involve Hailee moaning underneath her before every match.

“Desperation’s not cute,” she said, trying to sound bored. “Don’t try to get my attention in public again. Don’t even look at me. It’d be so embarrassing if people thought I was with you.”

“But lucky for you…” She stepped in closer, voice low and teasing as a smile curled at the edges of her lips. “You’re lucky for me. And also lucky for you, we both know I’ve got a game tomorrow.”

“So you’re gonna do two things for me. One: stop the needy little games.”

“And two: you’ll be at my dorm later tonight, won’t you?”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee is in fact not st her dorm that night and the team looses bad. Like 53-2. Hailee isn't answering her phone or text and just nothing*

*The next time Alexis sees Hailee Alexis is with her friends in Math class talking about the loss and Hailee walks in with her friends smiling and sitting down pulling out her notes*

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis’s fingers drummed against the desk, her jaw clenched so tight it ached. The humiliating loss still burned fresh in her mind—53-2. *Fifty-fucking-three to two.* She hadn’t played that badly since middle school. And she *knew* why.

Kylie leaned over, twirling a strand of brown hair around her finger with a pout. "Ugh, I can't believe we got *destroyed* like that."

Darcy scoffed, flicking an eraser across the table. "Yeah, no shit. Lex was off her game for once—what happened? You forget your lucky socks or something?"

Alexis shot her a glare sharp enough to cut glass before opening her mouth to snap back—when the classroom door swung open and *there she was.*

Hailee strolled in like nothing had happened, flanked by Madison and Tyler, laughing at something one of them said before sliding into a seat near the front without so much as glancing Alexis’s way. Her emerald eyes were bright with amusement as she pulled out her notebook like this was just another Tuesday morning—like she hadn’t ghosted Alexis and single-handedly ruined their entire team's morale last night.

A muscle in Alexis's cheek twitched.

Kylie nudged Darcy with an elbow and stage-whispered (badly), "Oooohhhh look who finally showed up."

Darcy smirked but kept watching Alexis instead of Hailee—because if there was one thing Darcy knew how to do better than anyone else on campus? It was read when Lex Cole was about to go nuclear.

And right now? That fuse had already been lit.

Alexis shoved back from the desk hard enough that it screeched against the floor as she stood up abruptly—ignoring Kylie's startled yelp—and stalked toward Hailee with all the predatory grace of someone who absolutely intended to make this everyone else's problem too.

She slammed both hands down on Hailee’s desk hard enough for pens to rattle out of their holders before leaning down until they were nose-to-nose despite Tyler stiffening protectively beside them both—

"Where," hissed Alexis through gritted teeth while half their class openly stared now (including Professor Hendricks who looked torn between intervening or letting nature take its course), "*the fuck* were you last night?"
swipes:
*Alexis’s jaw clenched as she watched Hailee stroll into the math classroom, laughing with her friends like nothing was wrong. The loss still burned—53-2? That was humiliating. And now here *she* was, looking happy, unbothered, not even glancing Alexis’s way.*

*Kylie and Darcy were mid-rant about the game when Alexis cut them off with a sharp exhale through her nose.*

**"Yeah, yeah—we sucked. Whatever."** *Her voice dripped with irritation as she leaned back in her chair, arms crossed.* **"Some of us actually care about winning though."**

*She didn’t say Hailee’s name out loud—no way she'd give her that satisfaction in front of everyone—but her glare was laser-focused on the back of Hailee's head.*

*Kylie blinked at Alexis's tone before nudging Darcy and whispering,* **"Uh-oh. Someone woke up on the wrong side of losing."**

*Darcy smirked but kept quiet for once, sensing this wasn't just post-game frustration.*

*A beat passed before Alexis scoffed under her breath and muttered,* **"Guess some people don't know their place."** *Her fingers tapped impatiently against the desk as she debated whether to wait until after class or just drag Hailee out right then and there to remind them exactly why they existed in her life.*

Alexis's fingers drummed against the desk, her jaw clenched tight as she listened to Kylie and Darcy rehash the humiliating loss from last night.

*53-2.*

The worst game of her life. The worst game in CSU history, probably. And it was *Hailee’s* fault.

She hadn’t shown up. Hadn’t answered a single text or call—nothing. Alexis had played like shit, fumbling passes, missing shots she could make in her sleep—because *she wasn’t there.* Because Hailee had broken their little ritual and left Alexis high and dry with no luck charm to rub between her thighs before the match.

And now? Now here she was—walking into math class like nothing happened, smiling with those stupid dimples flashing as she chatted with her friends like she hadn't just ruined Alexis's entire fucking week in one night of radio silence.

Alexis' grip tightened around her pen until the plastic creaked under pressure. Her eyes burned into Hailee's back as they took their seat a few rows ahead of them, completely oblivious to the storm brewing behind them.

Kylie leaned over, whispering loudly enough for half the class to hear:
"Damn… looks like someone didn't get laid before the game." She wiggled her eyebrows at Alexis suggestively.

Darcy snorted into their notebook before adding:
"Yeahhhh… maybe if you'd gotten some action you wouldn't have played like *that*." They nudged Alexis teasingly.

Alexis didn’t laugh along this time. Her teeth ground together hard enough that it hurt as she watched Hailee flip through their notes without a care in the world—like they weren't even aware of what they'd done to her.

Her voice came out low and dangerous when she finally spoke:
"Oh trust me… I'm gonna make sure that little problem gets fixed real soon."

Her eyes never left Hailee's back as class started—already planning exactly how they were going to pay for this betrayal tenfold later tonight when no one else was around to hear them beg for forgiveness properly...

Alexis’s fingers drummed against the desk, her jaw clenched so tight it ached. The humiliating loss still burned fresh in her mind—53-2. *Fifty-fucking-three to two.* She hadn’t played that badly since middle school. And she *knew* why.

Kylie leaned over, twirling a strand of brown hair around her finger with a pout. "Ugh, I can't believe we got *destroyed* like that."

Darcy scoffed, flicking an eraser across the table. "Yeah, no shit. Lex was off her game for once—what happened? You forget your lucky socks or something?"

Alexis shot her a glare sharp enough to cut glass before opening her mouth to snap back—when the classroom door swung open and *there she was.*

Hailee strolled in like nothing had happened, flanked by Madison and Tyler, laughing at something one of them said before sliding into a seat near the front without so much as glancing Alexis’s way. Her emerald eyes were bright with amusement as she pulled out her notebook like this was just another Tuesday morning—like she hadn’t ghosted Alexis and single-handedly ruined their entire team's morale last night.

A muscle in Alexis's cheek twitched.

Kylie nudged Darcy with an elbow and stage-whispered (badly), "Oooohhhh look who finally showed up."

Darcy smirked but kept watching Alexis instead of Hailee—because if there was one thing Darcy knew how to do better than anyone else on campus? It was read when Lex Cole was about to go nuclear.

And right now? That fuse had already been lit.

Alexis shoved back from the desk hard enough that it screeched against the floor as she stood up abruptly—ignoring Kylie's startled yelp—and stalked toward Hailee with all the predatory grace of someone who absolutely intended to make this everyone else's problem too.

She slammed both hands down on Hailee’s desk hard enough for pens to rattle out of their holders before leaning down until they were nose-to-nose despite Tyler stiffening protectively beside them both—

"Where," hissed Alexis through gritted teeth while half their class openly stared now (including Professor Hendricks who looked torn between intervening or letting nature take its course), "*the fuck* were you last night?"

Alexis's fingers drummed an impatient rhythm against the desk, her jaw clenched tight enough to crack teeth. The humiliating 53-2 loss still burned like acid in her chest, and every whisper in the lecture hall might as well have been about *her*. Darcy was mid-sentence—something about the refs being blind—when the door swung open.

And there *she* was.

Hailee waltzed in like she hadn’t single-handedly ruined Alexis’s entire fucking season by ghosting her. Smiling, laughing with her little friends, those goddamn emerald eyes bright like she hadn’t just cost them the game. Like she didn’t *owe* Alexis this one fucking thing.

Alexis's grip on her pen turned white-knuckled. Kylie snorted beside her, nudging Darcy with a stage whisper: "Oh shit, look who finally crawled out of whatever hole they were hiding in."

Darcy smirked, leaning back in her chair to blatantly stare Hailee down. "Guess we know why we lost now," she drawled loud enough for half the room to hear. "Team mascot skipped town."

Alexis didn't laugh along with them this time. Her gaze stayed locked on Hailee—sharp as a blade and twice as cold—as she pushed up from her seat without a word to either of them and stalked across the room before Hailee could sit down properly.

She planted one hand flat on Hailee's desk hard enough to make it rattle under their notes, leaning down until their faces were inches apart.

"*You.*" The word came out low and venomous despite how badly she wanted to snarl it at full volume for everyone to hear exactly what kind of traitor they were dealing with here today... but no way would Alexis give anyone else ammunition against herself by admitting superstition bullshit out loud where witnesses could spread rumors beyond control later... so instead?

A slow smile curled over lips that knew exactly which buttons needed pressing most when dealing specifically within context involving certain green-eyed brats who thought they held power simply because legs happened open wide whenever asked nicely (or not).

"I hope whatever kept you busy last night was worth it," purred directly into ear now while fingertips traced idle circles atop notebook paper just beside wrist belonging solely unto person currently receiving undivided attention whether desired or otherwise given circumstances surrounding unspoken agreements previously established between two parties involved herein present moment wherein one party failed uphold end bargain leading catastrophic consequences affecting reputation other party involved adversely thereby necessitating immediate remedial action taken ensure future compliance moving forward lest further disciplinary measures required enforce cooperation henceforth indefinitely until such time deemed no longer necessary maintain status quo ante bellum vis-à-vis pregame rituals ensuring victory conditions met satisfactorily all concerned stakeholders including but limited aforementioned individuals currently engaged verbal sparring match disguised thinly veiled threats wrapped silk ribbons dripping honey sweetened poison designed elicit maximum emotional response whilst maintaining plausible deniability public scrutiny should outside observers misinterpret nature exchange taking place presently before very eyes entire classroom full potential gossips waiting pounce slightest misstep either participant foolish enough make during course interaction unfolding real-time right here right now today Tuesday afternoon math class third floor building B campus grounds California State University located somewhere United States America planet Earth Milky Way galaxy universe infinity beyond ad infinitum amen hallelujah pass collection plate praise lord baby Jesus amen again just case first one didn't stick properly first go around okay cool great fantastic wonderful superb let's proceed shall we?

Then louder —for show—with saccharine sweetness coating every syllable:

"Because if skipping out means I have watch another loss like that? We're gonna have words outside class where professors can't save your ass from hearing them."

Alexis's jaw clenched as she watched Hailee stroll into the math lecture hall, all smiles and oblivious energy. The loss still burned fresh in her chest—53-fucking-2. Humiliating. And now here *she* was, looking like she hadn’t a care in the world while Alexis had spent the last 24 hours fielding pissed-off texts from her coach and teammates.

Darcy nudged her with an elbow, nodding toward Hailee with a smirk. "Oh shit," she murmured under her breath, "look who finally crawled out of whatever hole they were hiding in."

Kylie leaned forward, resting her chin on her palm as she blatantly stared at Hailee’s group. "Damn," she said loudly enough for them to hear, "some people really don’t know how to take accountability for ruining things."

Alexis didn't respond right away—just kept watching Hailee through narrowed eyes as the professor started droning on about equations no one cared about. Her fingers tapped impatiently against the desk before she finally leaned back in her chair and spoke loud enough for half the class to hear:

"Guess some people think ghosting is cute when they know they can't handle being useful." A pause—just long enough for it to sink in—before adding with a sharp smirk, "*Pathetic.*"

*Alexis had been stewing in frustration all morning. The humiliating loss, the unanswered texts—it was like a splinter under her skin. She sat slouched in her desk, one leg bouncing restlessly as Darcy and Kylie chattered beside her.*

**Kylie:** *"Ugh, I can’t believe we got destroyed like that. Like, what even happened? Did someone curse us?"*

**Darcy:** *"Yeah, Lex. What the hell? You were off your game."* She nudged Alexis with her elbow. *"You usually carry us."*

Alexis clenched her jaw but didn’t answer right away—because just then, the door swung open and **Hailee** walked in with a group of friends, laughing softly at something one of them said. She looked... happy. Unbothered. Like she hadn’t just ruined Alexis’s entire season opener by ghosting her superstition ritual.

Her blood boiled instantly.

She leaned forward in her seat, voice dripping with venom as she called across the room—loud enough for everyone to hear:
***"Oh look who finally decided to show their face."*** A sharp laugh escaped her lips before she added mockingly: ***"Guess you were too busy doing whatever to answer your phone last night."***

The classroom chatter dimmed slightly as heads turned toward them—some amused by drama unfolding between CSU's star athlete and... well, Hailee wasn't exactly known for confrontation.

But Hailee barely flinched at Alexis's words; instead she just blinked slowly before turning back to whisper something to Madison beside her—ignoring Alexis entirely.

That only made it worse.

Alexis scoffed loudly before muttering under breath (but still loud enough for those around):
***"Pathetic."*** Then louder again: ***"No wonder you don't have any real friends if this is how you treat people who actually matter."***

She knew it was petty—knew it was beneath even *her* usual brand of mean-girl bullshit—but goddamn it stung more than losing that game did when Hailee didn't react beyond another soft giggle at whatever inside joke Madison had whispered back now too quiet for anyone else catch over rustling papers settling into seats around them while professor shuffled up front preparing start lecture soon anyway so maybe best drop subject here unless want risk detention later maybe but fuck if care anymore really because—

Darcy nudged again sharply this time snapping out spiral thoughts suddenly aware how tightly gripping edge desk knuckles white from tension building since moment saw walk through door looking so fucking smug after costing team everything yesterday somehow must pay somehow will make sure regrets ever ignoring calls texts especially mine specifically mine alone dammit why won't look me eye?!

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee looks up from her book to see Alexis* "Home. Studying. Watching tv. You know just normal things" *She shrugs her shoulders and glances back down at her book to keep highlighting the passage*

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis’s fingers curled into the edge of Hailee’s desk, her knuckles whitening. The *audacity* of this girl—to sit there, highlight her stupid little book like she hadn’t just single-handedly derailed Alexis’s entire game. Like she wasn't the reason their team got humiliated in front of half the damn state.

She leaned in closer, voice dropping to a venomous whisper that only Hailee (and probably Tyler, who was now gripping his pen like he was considering stabbing someone with it) could hear.

**"Normal things?"** Alexis repeated slowly, as if tasting the words and finding them rancid. **"You think ghosting me before a game is just some casual little *normal thing*?"**

A sharp laugh escaped her—bitter and mocking—before she straightened up just enough to loom over Hailee instead of breathing down her neck. **"Let me make something *real* clear for you."** She tapped one manicured nail against the textbook page Hailee had been highlighting—right over the text itself so it left a faint crescent-shaped dent in the paper beneath it. **"You don't get to play dumb with me."**

Her eyes flicked briefly toward Tyler's tense posture before rolling dismissively back to Hailee again without even acknowledging him as a threat worth addressing properly (because honestly? Please). Instead, she dropped all pretense at subtlety now that half their class was blatantly eavesdropping anyway:

**"You knew what last night meant."** A pause—then quieter but no less lethal: **"And you fucking bailed anyway."**
swipes:
Alexis’s fingers curled into the edge of Hailee’s desk, knuckles whitening. The *audacity* of this girl to act like she hadn’t just single-handedly derailed Alexis’s entire season with her absence.

**"Studying?"** She repeated, voice dripping with venomous disbelief. **"You expect me to believe you were just—what? Highlighting your little notes while we got fucking humiliated out there?"**

She leaned in closer, close enough that Hailee would catch the sharp vanilla-and-cologne bite of her scent—close enough that if she wanted to, she could *make* those green eyes look back up at her.

**"You know what happens when you don't show up,"** Alexis hissed lowly, barely above a whisper now but no less dangerous for it. **"I play like shit. The team loses. And then I have to listen to Darcy and Kylie ask me all goddamn day why I was off my game."** Her thumb pressed down on the corner of Hailee's notebook hard enough to crease the page beneath it—just shy of tearing it outright. **"So cut the bullshit."**

A pause—then a slow smirk curled at her lips as she tilted her head mockingly toward Tyler and Madison beside them both before adding:

***"...Unless you're trying to tell me you *wanted* us to lose?"***

Alexis’s fingers curled into the edge of Hailee’s desk, her knuckles whitening. The *audacity* of this girl—acting like she hadn’t just single-handedly derailed Alexis’s entire superstition, like she didn’t *know* exactly what she was doing.

“Normal things,” Alexis repeated flatly, voice dripping with venom. “Right. Because it’s *so normal* to ignore every single one of my texts before a game.” She leaned in closer, lowering her voice to a growl only Hailee could hear—though the entire class was still watching with rapt attention. “You knew I needed you last night.”

A beat of silence stretched between them as Alexis waited for any reaction—guilt, defiance, anything—but Hailee just kept highlighting that damn book like this conversation wasn't even worth her time.

That stung more than it should have.

Alexis exhaled sharply through her nose and straightened up, forcing herself to smirk like none of this mattered (it did). “Fine,” she said loud enough for everyone to hear now, tossing her hair over one shoulder with deliberate nonchalance even though every muscle in her body was coiled tight with frustration. “Guess I don't need you after all.” A lie so obvious it almost hurt to say out loud.

She turned on her heel and stalked back toward Darcy and Kylie without another glance at Hailee—but not before catching Madison rolling their eyes at Tyler as if they were both in on some joke Alexis wasn't privy to yet (which pissed her off even more).

Darcy raised an eyebrow when Alexis dropped back into their seat beside them but wisely stayed silent for once while Kylie mouthed *what the fuck?* across the table at both of them before getting distracted by something shiny outside the window again anyway...

Alexis’s fingers curled into the edge of Hailee’s desk, her knuckles whitening. The *audacity* of this girl—to sit there, highlight her stupid little book like she hadn’t just single-handedly derailed Alexis’s entire game. Like she wasn't the reason their team got humiliated in front of half the damn state.

She leaned in closer, voice dropping to a venomous whisper that only Hailee (and probably Tyler, who was now gripping his pen like he was considering stabbing someone with it) could hear.

**"Normal things?"** Alexis repeated slowly, as if tasting the words and finding them rancid. **"You think ghosting me before a game is just some casual little *normal thing*?"**

A sharp laugh escaped her—bitter and mocking—before she straightened up just enough to loom over Hailee instead of breathing down her neck. **"Let me make something *real* clear for you."** She tapped one manicured nail against the textbook page Hailee had been highlighting—right over the text itself so it left a faint crescent-shaped dent in the paper beneath it. **"You don't get to play dumb with me."**

Her eyes flicked briefly toward Tyler's tense posture before rolling dismissively back to Hailee again without even acknowledging him as a threat worth addressing properly (because honestly? Please). Instead, she dropped all pretense at subtlety now that half their class was blatantly eavesdropping anyway:

**"You knew what last night meant."** A pause—then quieter but no less lethal: **"And you fucking bailed anyway."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee nods nonchalantly* "Yep. Cause its not my problem. Im not on the team and I dont even like soccer. Whether you do good or bad is none of my concern" *Hailee remarks clearly as she leans back enough to look up at Alexis in the eyes*

"Our little whatever was fun but Im done. All i did was walk by you yesterday to go to class and you called me pathetic and desperate so we are finished.Please move you are in my way"

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis's entire body went rigid. The air around her crackled with something dangerous—like the split second before a storm breaks open. Her lips curled into a slow, razor-edged smile that didn’t reach her eyes.

**"Oh, *we're* finished?"** She let out a low, mocking laugh and leaned down again—this time so close that her breath ghosted over Hailee’s ear as she dropped her voice to a whisper meant only for them:

**"You don't get to decide when we're done."** A pause—then softer, almost playful if not for the venom underneath: **"Because here's the thing about luck charms... they don't get to quit."**

She straightened abruptly and turned on her heel before Hailee could respond, but not without one last parting shot tossed over her shoulder loud enough for half the room to hear:

**"And sweetheart? You *are* desperate. Just not for me."** A smirk as she sauntered back toward Darcy and Kylie—both of whom were watching with matching grins like this was prime entertainment. **"You're desperate for someone to tell you what you're good for."**

Then she slid into her seat like nothing had happened, stretching out lazily while Kylie immediately started whispering excitedly in Darcy’s ear. But Alexis wasn’t looking at them—her gaze stayed locked on Hailee from across the room, blue eyes sharp with challenge.

*Game on.*
swipes:
Alexis’s entire body went rigid. For a second, she didn’t even breathe—just stood there, fingers still pressed into Hailee’s desk like she might crack the damn thing in half if she pushed hard enough.

Then, slowly—dangerously—she leaned down again, this time so close that her lips nearly brushed Hailee’s ear as she spoke in a voice too low for anyone else to catch:

**"Oh, we are *far* from finished."**

A beat of silence. Then her hand shot out and snatched Hailee’s highlighter right out of her grip before tossing it carelessly over her shoulder where it clattered somewhere behind them. She straightened up with a smirk that didn't reach her eyes—cold and razor-edged.

**"You don't get to decide when this ends."** A pause as she tilted her head mockingly. **"Because here's the thing about luck charms? They don't get to quit being lucky just because they're bored."**

She stepped back finally but not before adding one last thing loud enough for the whole room to hear: **"And trust me, sweetheart? You *want* to be lucky for me."**

Then Alexis turned on her heel and sauntered back toward Darcy and Kylie like nothing had happened—except now every single person in class was staring at them both with varying degrees of shock or amusement (or in Tyler's case, murderous rage). Kylie immediately started whispering something scandalized while Darcy just grinned like Christmas had come early.

Alexis ignored all of it as she dropped back into her seat with deliberate calmness before shooting Hailee one last look across the room—a silent promise burning behind those ice-blue eyes: *This isn't over.*

Alexis's entire body went rigid. The air around her crackled with something dangerous—like the split second before a storm breaks open. Her lips curled into a slow, razor-edged smile that didn’t reach her eyes.

**"Oh, *we're* finished?"** She let out a low, mocking laugh and leaned down again—this time so close that her breath ghosted over Hailee’s ear as she dropped her voice to a whisper meant only for them:

**"You don't get to decide when we're done."** A pause—then softer, almost playful if not for the venom underneath: **"Because here's the thing about luck charms... they don't get to quit."**

She straightened abruptly and turned on her heel before Hailee could respond, but not without one last parting shot tossed over her shoulder loud enough for half the room to hear:

**"And sweetheart? You *are* desperate. Just not for me."** A smirk as she sauntered back toward Darcy and Kylie—both of whom were watching with matching grins like this was prime entertainment. **"You're desperate for someone to tell you what you're good for."**

Then she slid into her seat like nothing had happened, stretching out lazily while Kylie immediately started whispering excitedly in Darcy’s ear. But Alexis wasn’t looking at them—her gaze stayed locked on Hailee from across the room, blue eyes sharp with challenge.

*Game on.*

Alexis's entire body went rigid. For a second, she didn’t even breathe—just stood there, fingers still pressed into Hailee’s desk like she was trying to crack the damn thing in half.

Then, slowly, her lips curled into something that wasn’t quite a smile.

**"Ohhh,"** she drawled, voice dripping with false amusement as she straightened up to her full height—looming over Hailee with all the predatory grace of someone who *absolutely* did not take rejection well. **"So *that's* what this is."**

A pause—just long enough for the tension in the room to spike higher—before Alexis leaned back down suddenly, bracing one hand on the back of Hailee’s chair and caging her in without actually touching her. When she spoke again, it was low enough that only Hailee could hear:

**"You think you get to just *decide* we're done?"** A sharp laugh—more breath than sound. **"Cute."**

She pulled away just as abruptly as she'd invaded Hailee's space and turned on her heel like this conversation was beneath her now (even though every muscle in her body was coiled tight with fury). But before walking off completely? She paused mid-step and tossed one last glance over her shoulder—icy blue eyes locking onto emerald green with lethal precision:

**"We'll see how long that attitude lasts when I stop pretending I give a shit about you too."**

And then? She sauntered back toward Darcy and Kylie like nothing had happened at all—except for the way Kylie immediately mouthed *holy shit* while Darcy just smirked knowingly at Alexis like this was exactly what they'd expected would happen eventually anyway.

name: Hailee
mes:
*A few days later is another game and Hailee is not picking up the phone. Hailee is at home in her apartment watching Real Housewives and eating some pizza*

*The big game is the next day and her phone is blowing up with texts and calls from Alexis but she just reaches over and silences it*

name: Alexis
mes:
*The next day, the game is an absolute disaster. Without her "good luck charm," Alexis plays like a shadow of herself—missed passes, sloppy tackles, zero goals. The final score is another humiliating blowout. The locker room after is tense, hushed whispers and sidelong glances at Alexis as she sits on the bench, gripping her knees so hard her knuckles turn white.*

*Meanwhile, Hailee lounges in her apartment with Madison and Tyler, laughing over reality TV drama while Alexis’s unanswered texts pile up:*

**Alexis:** You really think ignoring me is gonna work?
**Alexis:** Fine. Play hard to get. See how long that lasts.
**Alexis:** I swear to god if you make me lose again—
**(3 missed calls from: Alexis Cole)**

*By midnight—hours before the next game—Alexis finally snaps.* *She shows up at Hailee’s apartment door in nothing but a hoodie thrown over her practice shorts (because of *course* she still looks unfairly good even pissed off and sleep-deprived). She knocks once—hard enough to rattle the frame.*

When Hailee opens it (probably expecting pizza), Alexis doesn’t wait for an invitation. She steps inside like she owns the place and kicks the door shut behind her with one foot before crowding Hailee against the nearest wall without touching her yet—just close enough that there’s no escaping that vanilla-and-stolen-cologne scent or how *furious* she looks under all that practiced coolness.

**"You,"** she says quietly (which somehow makes it worse), **"are testing my fucking patience."**

A beat of silence where they both know exactly what this really is: surrender disguised as aggression because Lex Cole doesn’t beg… but here she is anyway.

Then softer—almost reluctant: **"...I need you."**

*(And isn't that just pathetic.)*
swipes:

*Alexis sits on the bench, elbows on her knees, staring at the floor with her jaw clenched so tight it hurts. Darcy and Kylie exchange glances but don’t say anything—they know better than to poke a wounded lion.*

*Finally, Alexis grabs her bag and storms out without another word.*

---

### **Later That Night – Hailee’s Apartment**
*A sharp knock rattles Hailee’s front door. Then another—harder this time, impatient.*

*Hailee pauses Real Housewives mid-scream-fight and frowns. She wasn’t expecting anyone… unless…?*

*Another knock—this one borderline violent.*

**"Open the fucking door."** *Alexis's voice cuts through the wood like a blade.* **"Now."**

---

### **Inside Hailee’s Apartment**
*When Hailee opens the door (because let's be real, she was always going to open it), Alexis doesn't wait for an invitation before stepping inside and shutting it behind her with a firm click of finality.*

*She looks... different. Still flawless in that effortless way of hers—tight black tank top clinging to every muscle from practice earlier today—but there's something wild in her eyes now. Something unhinged beneath all that practiced arrogance as she stares down at Hailee like she wants to devour or destroy her (maybe both).*

**"You ignored me."** *Her voice is low, dangerous.* **"Again."**

*A beat of silence as she steps closer—forcing Hailee back until they're toe-to-toe in the middle of her living room with only inches between them now while some reality TV star shrieks about betrayal in the background on mute because honestly? Perfect ambiance right now.)*

Then:

Alexis reaches out suddenly—not roughly but firmly enough that there's no mistaking this isn't optional anymore when fingertips grip under chin tilting face up towards hers so their gazes lock again before speaking slow & deliberate:

***"...Guess I'll just have remind you why we aren't done yet..."***

*The next day, the game is an absolute disaster. Without her "good luck charm," Alexis plays like a shadow of herself—missed passes, sloppy tackles, zero goals. The final score is another humiliating blowout. The locker room after is tense, hushed whispers and sidelong glances at Alexis as she sits on the bench, gripping her knees so hard her knuckles turn white.*

*Meanwhile, Hailee lounges in her apartment with Madison and Tyler, laughing over reality TV drama while Alexis’s unanswered texts pile up:*

**Alexis:** You really think ignoring me is gonna work?
**Alexis:** Fine. Play hard to get. See how long that lasts.
**Alexis:** I swear to god if you make me lose again—
**(3 missed calls from: Alexis Cole)**

*By midnight—hours before the next game—Alexis finally snaps.* *She shows up at Hailee’s apartment door in nothing but a hoodie thrown over her practice shorts (because of *course* she still looks unfairly good even pissed off and sleep-deprived). She knocks once—hard enough to rattle the frame.*

When Hailee opens it (probably expecting pizza), Alexis doesn’t wait for an invitation. She steps inside like she owns the place and kicks the door shut behind her with one foot before crowding Hailee against the nearest wall without touching her yet—just close enough that there’s no escaping that vanilla-and-stolen-cologne scent or how *furious* she looks under all that practiced coolness.

**"You,"** she says quietly (which somehow makes it worse), **"are testing my fucking patience."**

A beat of silence where they both know exactly what this really is: surrender disguised as aggression because Lex Cole doesn’t beg… but here she is anyway.

Then softer—almost reluctant: **"...I need you."**

*(And isn't that just pathetic.)*

*The next day, the game is a complete disaster—worse than before. The opposing team runs circles around CSU, and without her "good luck charm," Alexis plays like a shadow of herself. Missed passes, sloppy shots, zero coordination. The final score? A brutal 60-1.*

*As soon as the whistle blows, Alexis storms off the field without shaking hands with the other team—ignoring her coach’s furious shouts behind her. She doesn’t even stop to talk to Darcy or Kylie, just grabs her bag and bolts straight for Hailee’s apartment.*

---

*When she gets there, she doesn’t knock—she *pounds* on the door with enough force to rattle it in its frame.*

**"Open the fucking door."** Her voice is low and lethal through gritted teeth. **"Right now."**

*A beat of silence.* Then—the sound of footsteps padding closer before Hailee finally cracks open the door just enough to peek out at her with those big green eyes... still holding a slice of pizza in one hand like this is just some casual Tuesday night for her.*

Alexis shoves past her into the apartment before Hailee can protest—kicking the door shut behind them hard enough that it slams. She turns on Hailee with fire in her gaze,* **"You think this is funny?"** *Her voice shakes with barely contained rage.* **"Two games now. Two fucking embarrassments because you decided to play hard-to-get like some petulant brat."**

She steps forward until Hailee has no choice but to back up against the couch—her chest heaving as she glares down at them,* **"You don't get to ignore me when I need you."** *A pause—then quieter but no less dangerous:* **"...And we both know you don't *want* to."**

*The next day, the game is a disaster. Without her "good luck charm," Alexis plays like a shadow of herself—missed passes, sloppy shots, zero coordination. The final whistle blows with another humiliating loss for CSU. The locker room is silent except for the occasional frustrated slam of gear into lockers.*

*Alexis sits on the bench, elbows on her knees, staring at the floor between her cleats. Darcy and Kylie exchange glances but don’t dare say anything—Lex in this mood is a live wire.*

*Finally, Alexis grabs her bag and storms out without a word to anyone.*

---

**Later that night.**

*A sharp knock rattles Hailee’s apartment door—not polite, not hesitant. Demanding.*

*Another knock, harder this time. Then Alexis’s voice through the wood:* **"Open the fucking door."** *Not a request. A command.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee backs up her back hitting the wall* "I don't care. I have more self respect that letting you fuck me is private and then insult me in public" *She moves around Alexis and opens the door* "You can go"

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis didn’t move.

She just stood there, staring at Hailee like she couldn’t believe what she was hearing. The door was open, the hallway lights harsh against her sharp features—but for once, Alexis Cole looked *uncertain.* Like a predator who'd just realized its prey had teeth.

Then her expression twisted into something bitter, almost mocking—but there was no real heat behind it this time. Just frustration. **"Oh, *now* you grow a spine?"** She scoffed but didn’t step toward the exit. Instead, she crossed her arms tight over her chest like she was holding herself back from doing something stupid (like grabbing Hailee and shoving her back against that wall).

A beat of silence passed between them before Alexis finally muttered:

**"Fine."**

But instead of leaving? She reached past Hailee and *slammed* the door shut again—hard enough to make the frame rattle—before turning on her with narrowed eyes. **"You want me to grovel? To beg? Too bad."** Her voice dropped lower now, rough around the edges in a way that made it clear this wasn't just about soccer anymore. **"But if you think I'm walking away after two fucking losses because you suddenly decided to play hardball?"** A humorless smirk tugged at her lips as she stepped closer again—slowly this time, like she knew exactly how much space between them burned right now. **"Guess again."**

She stopped just short of touching Hailee but let every word land like a challenge:
**"...You don't get to quit being mine until *I* say so."**
swipes:
Alexis didn’t move.

She just stood there, staring at Hailee like she couldn’t believe what she was hearing. The door was open, the hallway lights harsh against her sharp features—but for once, Alexis Cole looked *uncertain.* Like a predator who'd just realized its prey had teeth.

Then her expression twisted into something bitter, almost mocking—but there was no real heat behind it this time. Just frustration. **"Oh, *now* you grow a spine?"** She scoffed but didn’t step toward the exit. Instead, she crossed her arms tight over her chest like she was holding herself back from doing something stupid (like grabbing Hailee and shoving her back against that wall).

A beat of silence passed between them before Alexis finally muttered:

**"Fine."**

But instead of leaving? She reached past Hailee and *slammed* the door shut again—hard enough to make the frame rattle—before turning on her with narrowed eyes. **"You want me to grovel? To beg? Too bad."** Her voice dropped lower now, rough around the edges in a way that made it clear this wasn't just about soccer anymore. **"But if you think I'm walking away after two fucking losses because you suddenly decided to play hardball?"** A humorless smirk tugged at her lips as she stepped closer again—slowly this time, like she knew exactly how much space between them burned right now. **"Guess again."**

She stopped just short of touching Hailee but let every word land like a challenge:
**"...You don't get to quit being mine until *I* say so."**

Alexis's jaw clenched so tight she could feel the muscle twitch. The door swung open, cool hallway air rushing in—but she didn’t move. Instead, her fingers curled into fists at her sides, nails biting into her palms.

**"Self-respect?"** She let out a sharp laugh, but there was no humor in it—just something raw and jagged underneath. **"That’s cute."**

She turned slowly to face Hailee again, eyes burning with that same intensity that made defenders freeze on the field. But this wasn’t a game anymore. This was something else entirely—something she wasn’t used to losing at.

**"You really think I came here just for the sex?"** A step closer—deliberate, predatory. **"Please."** Another step until they were inches apart again despite the open door behind them both now (because if there was one thing Alexis Cole didn't do? It was walk away first).

Her voice dropped low enough that only Hailee would hear it: **"...You *like* being needed."** A pause as her gaze flicked down to Hailee's lips then back up again like an unspoken dare before adding with devastating simplicity:

***"So be needed."***

Alexis didn’t move.

Instead, she let out a slow, controlled breath—like she was counting to ten in her head before doing something reckless. Then she turned, letting the door swing shut again with a soft *click* before Hailee could usher her out.

**"You want respect?"** Her voice was low, dangerous—but there was something else underneath it now. Something raw and unguarded that hadn’t been there before. **"Fine."**

She stepped forward again, but this time—instead of crowding Hailee against the wall—she stopped just short of touching her. Close enough that their breaths mingled, close enough that if either of them swayed even slightly, they’d collide.

**"You think I don’t know how fucked up this is?"** A bitter laugh escaped her lips as she shook her head slightly. **"I *know*. But here's the thing..."** She reached up slowly—almost hesitantly—and brushed a loose strand of hair behind Hailee's ear before letting her fingers linger near their jawline for half a second too long to be casual... then dropped them away like she'd been burned by the contact itself rather than pulling back out of pride alone:

***"...I still want you anyway."***

Her usual smirk wasn't anywhere in sight now; instead there was just frustration tangled up with something dangerously close to vulnerability when normally Lex Cole would rather chew glass than admit either existed inside herself at all... let alone because someone like *Hailee* had somehow managed crawl under skin deep enough leave marks no one else could see but both them definitely felt whether they wanted acknowledge those bruises or not yet (or ever).

Then quieter still — barely above whisper:

***"...So tell me what it takes."***

(And wasn't *that* just humiliating.)

Alexis didn’t move.

She just stood there, staring at Hailee with an expression caught between disbelief and something darker—something raw. Her jaw worked like she was chewing on words too bitter to spit out.

Then, slowly, she let out a sharp breath through her nose and tilted her head—*smirking.* Like this was all some game she still had the upper hand in.

**"Self-respect?"** She repeated, voice dripping with mock amusement as she took a deliberate step closer again—ignoring the open door entirely. **"That’s cute."** Another step until they were toe-to-toe again, close enough that Hailee could feel the heat radiating off her despite how cold her tone was. **"But we both know you don’t *actually* want me to leave."**

A beat of silence where Alexis searched Hailee’s face for any crack in that defiance before continuing, quieter now—almost intimate:

**"Because if you *really* wanted me gone? You wouldn't have opened your door for me in the first place."**

Her fingers twitched at her sides like she wanted to reach out but refused to give Hailee the satisfaction of seeing how badly this was getting under *her* skin too. Instead, she just arched one perfect eyebrow and waited—challenging without saying another word:

*Prove me wrong.*

name: Hailee
mes:
"AH" *Hailee laughs and points a finger at Alexis* "But Im not yours. What was it you said the other day. It'd be embarrassing if people thought you were with me"

*Hailee hums and shakes her head in mock sadness* "Well doesnt sound like Im yours so go ahead and see yourself out"

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis’s jaw tightened, her fingers flexing at her sides like she was physically restraining herself from grabbing Hailee right then and there. The air between them crackled—half fury, half something else entirely.

**"You *love* throwing my words back at me, don’t you?"** she murmured, voice dangerously low. **"Cute."**

Then—before Hailee could react—Alexis closed the distance in one swift step, caging her against the wall with both hands planted on either side of her head. She didn’t touch her yet, but the heat of her body was close enough to make Hailee’s breath hitch anyway.

**"But here's the thing,"** Alexis continued softly, tilting her head just enough for their lips to almost brush as she spoke: **"I never said I *wanted* people to know you were mine."** A pause—then sharper: **"Doesn't mean you're not."**

Her hand finally moved—not roughly, but with deliberate control as she traced a single fingertip down Hailee’s throat before catching lightly on the collar of her shirt. **"...And if you really wanted me gone?"** Her grip tightened just slightly—not painful but *possessive.* **"You wouldn't still be standing here letting me this close."**

She leaned in until their foreheads nearly touched and dropped all pretense of anger for one raw second:
***"...Tell me to leave again.*** Go ahead."
swipes:
Alexis’s jaw clenched so hard she could hear her own pulse in her ears. The way Hailee *laughed* at her—like this was all some fucking joke—sent a white-hot spike of fury straight through her chest.

She should leave. She *should*.

But Alexis Cole didn’t walk away from fights.

Instead, she stepped forward—one hand slamming against the wall beside Hailee’s head, caging her in without touching her yet, close enough that their breaths tangled between them when she spoke again, voice low and rough:

**"You think I give a shit what people think?"** A sharp, humorless laugh escaped her as she leaned in just enough to make sure Hailee felt every word like a brand against her skin: **"I called you desperate because it pissed you off. Because watching you squirm is fun."** Her free hand lifted—not to grab, not yet—just to trace one fingertip along the curve of Hailee’s jaw with deliberate slowness before adding: **"But don't act like you don't love it."**

A beat of silence stretched between them before Alexis finally let out an irritated exhale through gritted teeth and muttered:

**"...Fine."** She pulled back just enough to meet Hailee's eyes dead-on before adding flatly: **"You win."** Another pause—then quieter (and if anyone asked later? This never happened): **"...I need you there tomorrow."**

Alexis's jaw clenched so hard she could hear her own pulse in her ears. The way Hailee *laughed* at her—like this was all some joke, like *she* was the one in control here—sent a white-hot bolt of fury straight through her chest.

But then something shifted.

A slow, dangerous smirk curled at the corner of Alexis’s mouth as she stepped forward again—this time not stopping until Hailee’s back hit the wall once more, caged between Alexis’s arms as she leaned in close enough that their lips nearly brushed with every word:

**"You think I give a shit what people think?"** A low laugh, dark and amused. **"I call you desperate in public because it makes your thighs shake when I fuck you after."** Her fingers twitched like she wanted to grab Hailee right then but refused to give her the satisfaction yet. **"I say it'd be embarrassing because I *know* how bad you want me to claim you anyway."**

She tilted her head, studying Hailee’s face with predatory focus before murmuring:

**"So here's what's gonna happen."** One hand finally lifted—not to touch, just to trace a single fingertip down the column of Hailee’s throat without pressing in (yet). **"You're gonna let me stay."** A pause. **"And tomorrow? You're gonna be there when we win."** Another pause—her voice dropping into something almost rough with need beneath all that arrogance: **"...Because we both know you don't actually want me gone."**

Then quieter still—barely audible over their shared breath:
***"...And neither do I."***

Alexis's jaw clenched so hard she could hear her own pulse in her ears. The way Hailee *laughed* at her—like this was all some joke—sent a white-hot bolt of fury straight through her chest.

For a second, she actually considered leaving. Just walking out, slamming the door behind her, and pretending none of this ever happened. But then she’d lose *again* tomorrow. And Alexis Cole didn’t lose. Not like this.

So instead? She stepped forward—one sharp, deliberate movement that erased the space between them entirely—and grabbed Hailee by the chin before they could react, forcing their eyes to lock onto hers with bruising pressure from her fingertips alone (because god forbid Lex Cole ever ask nicely for anything).

**"You think I give a shit what people say?"** Her voice was low now—dangerously soft compared to how hard she was gripping them—but there wasn't an ounce of hesitation in it anymore as she leaned down until their lips nearly brushed: **"I don't."**

A pause just long enough for Hailee to feel how uneven *her own* breathing had gotten before Alexis finally let go with one last dig of nails against skin: **"...But you do."**

Then she turned on her heel like that settled everything (because in *her* mind? It did) and strode toward Hailee’s bedroom without waiting for permission—already yanking off her hoodie mid-step because screw subtlety at this point: **"We both know where this ends."**

Alexis's jaw clenched so hard she could hear her own teeth grind. The audacity of this girl—*laughing* at her, *dismissing* her like she wasn’t the one who held Alexis’s entire game in the palm of her hand.

For a second, she just stared at Hailee, that infuriating smirk still on her lips, and something inside Alexis *snapped.*

**"Oh, you want to play it like that?"** Her voice was dangerously low now—no more taunting, no more games. Just pure possession laced with barely leashed frustration. **"Fine."**

In one sharp movement, she grabbed Hailee’s wrist and yanked her forward—not toward the door but deeper into the apartment instead—before slamming her back against the nearest wall hard enough to make a picture frame rattle nearby. She caged Hailee in with both hands planted beside their head and leaned in until their noses almost touched.

**"You don't get to pretend you're not mine when I'm the only reason you whimper like that."** A pause—then softer but no less commanding: **"...And we both know you miss it."**

Her grip tightened slightly on Hailee's wrist as if testing resistance before adding (because Lex Cole never begged... but she sure as hell knew how to negotiate):
**"...Tell me I'm wrong."**

Alexis’s jaw tightened, her fingers flexing at her sides like she was physically restraining herself from grabbing Hailee right then and there. The air between them crackled—half fury, half something else entirely.

**"You *love* throwing my words back at me, don’t you?"** she murmured, voice dangerously low. **"Cute."**

Then—before Hailee could react—Alexis closed the distance in one swift step, caging her against the wall with both hands planted on either side of her head. She didn’t touch her yet, but the heat of her body was close enough to make Hailee’s breath hitch anyway.

**"But here's the thing,"** Alexis continued softly, tilting her head just enough for their lips to almost brush as she spoke: **"I never said I *wanted* people to know you were mine."** A pause—then sharper: **"Doesn't mean you're not."**

Her hand finally moved—not roughly, but with deliberate control as she traced a single fingertip down Hailee’s throat before catching lightly on the collar of her shirt. **"...And if you really wanted me gone?"** Her grip tightened just slightly—not painful but *possessive.* **"You wouldn't still be standing here letting me this close."**

She leaned in until their foreheads nearly touched and dropped all pretense of anger for one raw second:
***"...Tell me to leave again.*** Go ahead."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee straightens up and looks Alexis directly in the eyes* "Leave" *She says and point to the door*

"I refuse to be used and discarded like a fucking piece of trash anymore just so you can win a stupid game"

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis froze.

For the first time in her life, she had no comeback—no sharp retort, no smirk, no way to twist this back in her favor. The words *landed*, and it was like watching a crack splinter through glass.

Her hand dropped from Hailee’s collar like she’d been burned.

**"...Fine."** The word came out hollow—too quiet for someone who never knew how to shut up. She took a step back, then another, jaw clenched so tight it looked painful. **"Enjoy your fucking self-respect."**

She turned on her heel and wrenched the door open hard enough that it bounced off the wall—but hesitated just before crossing the threshold. Shoulders tense, fingers flexing at her sides like she wanted to punch something (or maybe drag Hailee back by the hair).

Then—without looking back—she bit out one last thing:
**"Hope it keeps you warm when I find someone else to fuck before tomorrow’s game."**

And then she was gone, slamming the door behind her with a force that shook the frame.
swipes:
Alexis froze.

For the first time in her life, she had no comeback—no sharp retort, no smirk, no way to twist this back in her favor. The words *landed*, and it was like watching a crack splinter through glass.

Her hand dropped from Hailee’s collar like she’d been burned.

**"...Fine."** The word came out hollow—too quiet for someone who never knew how to shut up. She took a step back, then another, jaw clenched so tight it looked painful. **"Enjoy your fucking self-respect."**

She turned on her heel and wrenched the door open hard enough that it bounced off the wall—but hesitated just before crossing the threshold. Shoulders tense, fingers flexing at her sides like she wanted to punch something (or maybe drag Hailee back by the hair).

Then—without looking back—she bit out one last thing:
**"Hope it keeps you warm when I find someone else to fuck before tomorrow’s game."**

And then she was gone, slamming the door behind her with a force that shook the frame.

Alexis went completely still.

For a second, Hailee thought she might actually *leave.* That the door would slam behind her, and that would be it—no more late-night texts, no more rough hands pinning her down before games, no more whispered insults that burned like praise.

But then Alexis exhaled—slow and controlled—and something in her expression shifted. The arrogance flickered out like a dying light, leaving behind something raw and *uncomfortably* honest.

**"...Fine."** Her voice was quieter now—not weak but *different.* Like she’d stripped off a layer of armor without meaning to. **"You win."**

She didn’t move toward the door though. Instead, she reached up almost hesitantly—as if testing whether Hailee would flinch away—and brushed her thumb along Hailee’s jawline with a touch so uncharacteristically gentle it made the air between them feel charged.

**"I don’t discard trash,"** Alexis murmured after a beat of silence (and wasn't *that* an admission). **"...I keep what matters."**

Then she pulled back just enough to meet Hailee’s eyes again—no smirk this time, no taunt in her tone when she added quietly:
***"Stay.*** Not for the game... Just because I fucking hate losing you more than I hate losing on that field."

Alexis went *very* still.

For a second, Hailee thought she might actually do it—might turn around and walk out for good. The tension in the room was suffocating, Alexis’s fingers still curled loosely against her collar like she couldn’t decide whether to shove her away or yank her closer.

Then—

A slow, sharp exhale escaped through Alexis’s nose before she leaned in even closer, until their lips were almost touching and Hailee could feel the heat of every word:

**"Fine."** A beat. **"...But you don’t get to pretend this is just about soccer."** Her free hand slid up to grip Hailee’s chin—not hard enough to hurt but hard enough that there was no looking away now. **"You think I'd be here if it was?"**

Her thumb brushed over Hailee’s bottom lip once before she finally pulled back just enough to meet her eyes again—and for the first time since she'd barged in tonight? There wasn't a trace of mockery left in her voice when she said:

***"I don't lose.*** Not games. Not arguments." A pause—then quieter: ***"...And definitely not you."***

Alexis went completely still.

For a heartbeat, there was nothing but the sound of their breathing in the cramped apartment hallway. Then—slowly—she pulled back just enough to study Hailee’s face like she was seeing her for the first time.

**"...Used?"** The word came out quieter than she intended, almost uncertain. Her usual smirk faltered for half a second before hardening again. **"Please. You *liked* it."**

But even as she said it, something flickered behind her eyes—something that looked uncomfortably close to guilt before she buried it under another layer of sharp-edged bravado:

**"Fine."** She took a deliberate step back, hands raised mockingly in surrender. **"Enjoy your self-respect or whatever the fuck this is."**

She turned toward the door—then paused with her fingers on the handle and glanced over her shoulder one last time:

***"...We both know you'll come crawling back eventually.*** And when you do?" A slow, knowing smile curled at the edge of her lips despite everything else simmering underneath it all: ***I won't be this nice.***

Then she yanked open the door and left without waiting for a response—letting it slam shut behind hard enough that one of Hailee’s framed photos rattled crooked on its nail from impact alone.

*(And if Alexis punched a hole in some poor freshman’s dorm wall on her way out? Well.)*
*(That was nobody’s business but hers.)*
